snippet: When oil was both dwindling and polluting, a convergence of economic and environmental common sense helped environmentalists win mainstream converts. Now, new energy sources threaten to pit the greens and the blue-collar against one another.
abstract: When oil was both dwindling and polluting, a convergence of economic and environmental common sense helped environmentalists win mainstream converts. Now, new energy sources threaten to pit the greens and the blue-collar against one another.

headline.main: When the Choice Is Jobs or the Environment
